comment._content: In 1939, this is what rush hour looked like.

comment.author: 44060001@N02
comment._content: WHAT is being done at Copperhill TODAY?  The railroad is still there but looks as if it needs repairs; but, is any sulphuric acid coming from there today?

comment.author: 49675886@N07
comment._content: Acid production stopped in 2001 at Copperhill.  The company is still in operation today selling iron calcine that was produced in the 1970's - 80's and stockpiled.  The rail yard  and line belong to a Heritage tourism group who run passenger excursion over the "Old Line" and lease the yard for rail car storage.

comment.author: 31053639@N06
comment._content: Come visit Copperhill, TN.  The scenic wonder of the south.

comment.author: 62379908@N00
comment._content: I took the train ride.  Terrific!
